name: Shibuya Scramble Crossing
address: Shibuya Crossing, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-8010, Japan
description: Experience the energy of the world's busiest pedestrian crossing, where hundreds cross from all directions simultaneously.

name: Akihabara (Electric Town)
description: Dive into Tokyo's hub for electronics, anime, and manga. Explore multi-story stores, themed cafes, and arcades.
cost: Varies; entry to most stores is free

name: teamLab Planets TOKYO
address: 6 Chome-1-16 Toyosu, Koto City, Tokyo 135-0061, Japan
description: Immerse yourself in interactive digital art installations that engage all your senses.

name: Tokyo Disneyland and DisneySea
description: Experience the magic at Tokyo Disneyland or the unique nautical-themed DisneySea.

name: Tsukiji Outer Market
address: 4 Chome-16-2 Tsukiji, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0045, Japan
description: Savor fresh seafood, sushi, and traditional snacks in this bustling market.

name: Senso-ji Temple
address: 2 Chome-3-1 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
description: Visit Tokyo's oldest Buddhist temple, explore Nakamise Shopping Street, and experience traditional culture.

name: Ghibli Museum
description: Delve into the world of Studio Ghibli with exhibits, short films, and art displays.

name: Omoide Yokocho (Memory Lane)
address: 1 Chome-2 Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku City, Tokyo 160-0023, Japan
description: Relish grilled skewers and drinks in this nostalgic alleyway filled with tiny eateries.

name: Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden
description: A vast garden featuring Japanese, English, and French landscapes, ideal for relaxation.

name: Takeshita Street in Harajuku
address: 1 Chome Jingumae, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0001, Japan
description: Explore this vibrant street known for its trendy shops, unique fashion, and delicious crepes.

name: Animal Cafés (Owl, Cat, Hedgehog, etc.)
description: Enjoy coffee while interacting with owls, cats, hedgehogs, and other cute animals in unique themed cafés.

name: Sumo Morning Practice in Ryogoku
description: Watch sumo wrestlers train up close in a traditional sumo stable.
